DOC.brief_summary: This study is designed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of a Paclitaxel-coated percutaneous transluminal angioplasty (PTA) Catheter in the treatment of patients with peripheral arterial disease.
DOC.brief_title: Pivotal Trial of a Novel Paclitaxel-Coated Percutaneous Angioplasty Balloon
DOC.detailed_description: The ILLUMENATE Pivotal study is a prospective, randomized, multi-center, single-blind study which will include up to 360 subjects in approximately forty-five (45) sites across the United States to evaluate the CVI Paclitaxel-coated PTA Catheter compared to the bare percutaneous transluminal angioplasty balloon catheter (bare balloon catheter) for the treatment of de-novo or post-PTA occluded/stenotic or reoccluded/restenotic (except for in-stent) SFA and/or popliteal arteries.
DOC.criteria: Subjects with symptomatic leg ischemia, requiring treatment of the Superficial Femoral Artery (SFA) or popliteal artery. Known intolerance to study medications, paclitaxel or contrast agents that in the opinion of the investigator cannot be adequately pretreated
